result.execSummary:
The defendant Derek M. Hillis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Outstanding financial obligations are not a condition of probation & are to be paid directly to the Shawano Co Clerk of Court office within 30 days.  Debts older than 60 days will be processed for tax intercept & civil judgments.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Payment plans available for qualifying amounts.

All financials same as noted above.
Defendant to submit DNA sample at Sheriff's Dept.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: letter dated 4-5-17 asking about huber - Judge response Huber for work only

Defendant Derek M. Hillis in court.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Right to counsel given - defendant proceeds w/o counsel.  Court accepts waiver of attorney for now.  Defendant enters a plea of no contest to both counts.  Court advises party of their rights, finds factual basis, accepts defendant's waiver of their rights, the plea made, and finds guilty.  DA makes his recommendation.  Defendant requests expungment (cannot because defendant is 27 years old).  Court orders $250 + costs, DNA sample on Ct. 1 and $100 + costs Ct. 2.  Appeal rights.
AIA - June 6,2016 hand delivered in courtroom.

Defendant Derek M. Hillis in court.  Catharine Denise White appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  ADA White - DE previously requested Atty. DE requests more time to hire attorney, requests 30 days.  Court grants 2 week adjournment, reminds DE of bond conditions.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 6, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Pictures & prints.
Absolute sobriety.
No drugs without a valid prescription.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 23, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant Derek M. Hillis in court.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Right to counsel given - defendant wishes to speak with an attorney.  To see the PD by 4 p.m. today.
